content.description:
Vibrational Witness climbs an undercut vertical face on an assortment of holds over a good landing. There is a slight sand factor to the start holds, but the remainder is fantastic.

Sit start with a pair of jugs and a high right foot. From there, crank up, lock a knee-bar into the initial sidepull, follow with a right hand to an edge, bump the left to a sloper which sets up a good-sized move to a sidepull (crux), then work up the remaining edges and huecos for an easy topout.

An alternate static method begins with a big cross with the left hand to the horizontal rail with a similar finish as the first method described above.
content.protection: A pad will do it, the landing is clear and flat.
content.location: It ascends the east face of Rainmaker Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand undercling/sidepull.  From there, move up through the two-finger pocket to the lip and a dirty topout.  The pocket is uncomfortable; bear down, move the feet right, and it's not too bad.
content.protection: A few pads, it has a good landing though.
content.location: It is on the East face of Rainmaker Rock.
